wikipedia_page.main: Charles Keith Holden (birth registered third ¼ 1937) is a former professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1950s and 1960s. He played at representative level for Great Britain, and at club level for Leigh (Heritage № 637), Wigan (Heritage № 589) (two spells),, Oldham RLFC (Heritage № 631), Warrington (Heritage № 636) and Blackpool Borough, as a centre, i.e. number 3 or 4.

link_mentions.page: List of Great Britain national rugby league team players

response: * Keith Holden won a cap for Great Britain while at Warrington in 1963 against Australia
